[[File:John Howe - Stewed Rabbit.jpg|thumb|''Stewed Rabbit'' by [[John Howe]]]]
{{quote|Do you remember that bit of rabbit, Mr. Frodo?|[[Sam Gamgee]] in ''[[The Return of the King]]'', "[[Mount Doom (chapter)|Mount Doom]]"}}
'''Rabbits''' were long-eared, furry animals, also called '[[Wiktionary:coney|coneys]]'. 

In {{TA|2747}}, the game of [[Golf]] was invented in the [[Battle of the Green Fields]] when [[Bandobras Took]] cut the head off the [[Orcs|Goblin]] King [[Golfimbul]] and his head flew through the air and went down a rabbit hole.<ref>{{H|Party}}</ref> After rescuing [[Thorin and Company]] the [[Eagles]] brought them rabbits to eat.<ref>{{H|Pan}}</ref> On [[7 March]] {{TA|3019}} in northern [[Ithilien]], [[Samwise Gamgee]] asked [[Gollum]] to bring him some food.  Gollum brought him two small rabbits which Sam proceeded to cook, to Gollum's intense displeasure.<ref>{{TT|IV4}}</ref>

==Etymology==
In a linguistic manuscript dating from the 1930s, appears the [[Quenya]] gloss '''''lopo''''' ("rabbit").<ref>{{PE|21}}, pp. 8, 31</ref> In earlier [[Qenya]], it was ''lapatte''.<ref>{{PE|12}}, p. 51</ref>

File:The Hobbit - An Unexpected Journey - Rhosgobel Rabbits.jpg|"Rhosgobel Rabbits" in ''[[The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey]]''

'''2002: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]]'':'''
:While they camp in [[Ithilien]], [[Gollum]] brings [[Frodo]] and [[Sam]] a pair of freshly caught rabbits. Sam is appalled at Gollum's suggestion that they eat the rabbits raw and replies "There's only one way to eat a brace of coneys..." Sam is then seen making rabbit stew in his cooking pot. Gollum wails at this, crying that by cooking them the fresh rabbit has been ruined.

'''2012-14: [[The Hobbit (film series)|''The Hobbit'' (film series)]]:'''
:[[Radagast]] drives a sled pulled by large rabbits, referred to as "[[Rhosgobel]] Rabbits".<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.theonering.net/torwp/2013/01/03/67872-radagasts-racing-rhosgobel-rabbits-a-recreational-musher-looks-at-the-realities-of-bunny-sledding/|articlename=Radagast's Racing Rhosgobel Rabbits: A Recreational Musher Looks at the Realities of Bunny Sledding|dated=3 January 2013|website=TORN|accessed=11 March 2013}}</ref>
